- This is the nearest airport to PSL. It is in nearby Fort Pierce. The airport has no commercial service, so bring your own plane.

PSL is easily accessible by car from
, and other points in South Florida via Interstate 95 and Florida's Turnpike.
Car is the easiest, if not only way to get around Port St. Lucie. There is very little public transportation and PSL is very sprawled, so driving is the only option.
Port St. Lucie has a small canal system that can be used to navigate parts of the city, with the river functioning as the central canal.

Play golf at one of the beautiful PGA Golf Club courses.
Go bowling at Superplay USA, or at St. Lucie Lanes.
Catch a baseball game at Tradition Field, the spring training home of the New York Mets.

There are many shopping options in PSL, mostly concentrated in shopping centers. Some major stores include Wal-Mart, Target, Lowes, and many more.
Most restaurants are popular chain restaurants, scattered on more traveled roads like PSL Blvd., Gatlin Blvd., U.S. 1, and West St. Lucie Blvd. These resturant chains include:

value: Duffy's, Burger King, McDonald's, Olive Garden

-- Florida has "no fault" auto accident laws, which means you are responsible for up to $10,000 in damage to your car, even if you are not responsible for the accident.  Make sure your rental car comes with collision insurance, or obtain separate insurance.  Florida also has a very high rate of auto fatalities, so take extra care on the roads. A lot of drivers in PSL can be very reckless at times and the amount of traffic is high for a city of it's size.
